content: quote: What America will leave behind in Iraq, at least in broad terms, is still unknown, but Iraqis already are living with what is sure to remain the war’s most personal vestige: the absence of the dead. Almost no Iraqi has escaped that trauma. No comprehensive, reliable civilian body count exists, but so many people have been killed in the past six years that it is nearly impossible to find an Iraqi who does not know someone who died violently, either because of actions by American troops or, far more commonly, in the widespread bloodletting that the invasion triggered. [McClatchy Newspapers, mcclatchydc.com, April 20, 2009] Regardless of the end results, unfortunately this is and always will be our legacy in Iraq. "None are more hopelessly enslaved than those who falsely believe they are free." -Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: quote: Originally posted by NSNN: quote: What America will leave behind in Iraq, at least in broad terms, is still unknown, but Iraqis already are living with what is sure to remain the war’s most personal vestige: the absence of the dead. Almost no Iraqi has escaped that trauma. No comprehensive, reliable civilian body count exists, but so many people have been killed in the past six years that it is nearly impossible to find an Iraqi who does not know someone who died violently, either because of actions by American troops or, far more commonly, in the widespread bloodletting that the invasion triggered. [McClatchy Newspapers, mcclatchydc.com, April 20, 2009] Regardless of the end results, unfortunately this is and always will be our legacy in Iraq. Really? How interesting. What genius came up with this theory paper? Amazing, how they leeave out, how many people I talked to, had relatives, taken away to rape/torture rooms by the Hussein regime. My unit found the first mass grave in Iraq in 2003. There have now been over 200 found. Let's guess, about 3,500 per site,(that's how many they thought they found in the one near Al Hillah) times 200. That's 700,000 bodies, many women & children. So let's quit blaming America for all the evils that happen in the world.

content: quote: Originally posted by NSNN: quote: What America will leave behind in Iraq, at least in broad terms, is still unknown, but Iraqis already are living with what is sure to remain the war’s most personal vestige: the absence of the dead. Almost no Iraqi has escaped that trauma. No comprehensive, reliable civilian body count exists, but so many people have been killed in the past six years that it is nearly impossible to find an Iraqi who does not know someone who died violently, either because of actions by American troops or, far more commonly, in the widespread bloodletting that the invasion triggered. [McClatchy Newspapers, mcclatchydc.com, April 20, 2009] Regardless of the end results, unfortunately this is and always will be our legacy in Iraq. It depends on who you talk to over there. The vast majority of Iraqis killed have been from insurgents and terrorists. Even more were killed before that by Saddam's regime. The Iraqis that I lived with were for the most part grateful that we were there to combat the insurgency. Ideally our legacy is bringing decades of terror by Saddam and now the terrorists and insurgents to minimal levels. One of my terps had lost a brother early on in the invasion, he didn't hold us responsible for that loss. Instead he went to work with us to combat the insurgents, and as an interpreter did so at great personal risk to him and his family.

content: Yep, we are leaving Iraq, Bush already had that in the works and guess who took credit for it? Your right, you get a ballon..Obama!!! Now just thing if Clinton and his admin would have had their Intell correct and said IRAQ DID NOT HAVE WMD's. I would stand right beside you all who say we should'nt be in Iraq. But, since Clinton and his admin to include John the commie Kerry (who sat on the Intell committee) said on many an occassion that IRAQ HAD WMD's!!!!!!!! And the Congress voted to go into Iraq base upon that bad intell. So once we got in there and the intell prove to be wrong, then what? You stay and finish the job. So don't go around blaming Bush for Clintons screw ups...blame the right people, even if it hurts and you have back down from Bush bashing. Man up!!!!!

content: Same argument could be made of Germany or Japan in WWII... How many innocent civilians died at the hands of Americans in WWII? How many innocent children died in fire bombings? How many civilians died due to the atomic bomb? (BTW: These are all rhetorical even sarcastic questions for those that don't realize it.) Exact same argument could be made. However, as I recall, I do believe that history has judged the US actions in both theatres pretty generously. Same will occur in Iraq.
reply: Same argument could be made of Germany or Japan in WWII... How many innocent civilians died at the hands of Americans in WWII? How many innocent children died in fire bombings? How many civilians died due to the atomic bomb? (BTW: These are all rhetorical even sarcastic questions for those that don't realize it.) Exact same argument could be made. However, as I recall, I do believe that history has judged the US actions in both theatres pretty generously. Same will occur in Iraq.
